newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY FORINT SEEN REMAINING STEADY VS NBH BASKET.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY FORINT SEEN REMAINING STEADY VS NBH BASKET.

text.p: Hungary's forint opened steady against the central bank's (NBH) dollar/mark currency basket and easier against the dollar on Tuesday and was expected to keep its position close to the NBH resistance level.

The forint opened right at the resistance level at 197.55/60 to one dollar and stood at 197.66/68 at 0750 GMT, well down on Monday's closing 196.60, following the mark's overnight losses against the dollar.
The forint floats within the NBH's 4.5 percent wide intervention range against a currency basket made up 30 percent of the dollar and 70 percent of the mark.

Dealers said the remote possibility of a weakening of the forint as dealers bought forex in response to Monday's fall in the value of Budapest stocks had evaporated following Monday's rise in the Dow.
"As the Dow moved back up that will be good news for all stock exchanges," said Attila Behan of ING Bank. "I now don't see any reason for the forint to move from the resostance level."

The BUX index of the Budapest Stock Exchange fell more than three percent on Monday on the back of a similar Friday fall on Wall Street but is expected to rally on Tuesday following the Dow's rebound.
All if Hungary's capital markets will be closed on Wednesday for a one-day public holiday.
